intro: Dactyladenia dinklagei, commonly known as the Dinklage's dactyladenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. It has a climbing habit and possesses specialized structures called stipules that aid in its growth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
